page.title: 02PORT CLARENCE AND HAVERTON
page.content: The industrial estate of {Port {Clarence}derives its name from the Clarence Railway which ran along the{ {Tees}opening in 1833. The estate flourished with the coming of the{Steel Industry}and the erection of three blast furnaces and an iron works opened by Bell Bros..The main industry of Port Clarence and its neighbour{Haverton Hill }was,however the production of {salt}one of the main natural resources of the area. Bell Bros.began borings and combined the production of salt with their iron manufacture.They pumped up liquid brine but were able to use the heat from hot slag beneath the salt pans to produce dry salt which was used for chemicals and industrial purposes.
